<rule id="security-03700" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <file filename="{*}oauth2{*}.jar"/>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="information" effort="0" title="Embedded library - OAuth 2.0">
                    <message>
                        The application embeds an OAuth 2.0 library. For Spring Boot applications, please ensure that the application is configured to use Spring Security OAuth2.

                        The Microsoft identity platform uses OAuth 2.0 and other protocols to enable applications to provide a Single Sign-On experience.

                        By migrating your SSO implementation to Azure AD with OAuth 2.0, you leverage the capabilities of Azure AD for managing identities and enabling secure SSO across your applications.
                        Azure AD offers features like multi-factor authentication, conditional access policies, and seamless integration with various SaaS applications, providing a robust and scalable solution for identity and access management in the cloud.
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/architecture/auth-oauth2" title="OAuth 2.0 authentication with Azure Active Directory"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/v2-protocols" title="OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect protocols on the Microsoft Identity Platform"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/v2-app-types" title="Application types and OAuth2"/>
                    <link href="https://spring.io/projects/spring-cloud-security/" title="Spring Cloud Security quickstart"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop" title="Microsoft identity platform documentation"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory" title="Azure Active Directory documentation"/>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">OAuth 2.0</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
